intro: Santiria rugosa, commonly known as rough santiria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive rough texture, giving it its common name. Santiria rugosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
